main event: A civilian reported seeing a single, oval-shaped, gray object in the sky over Boise, Idaho on July 15, 1967.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 20 seconds, during which it came down from the clouds, slowed down almost to a stop, and then sped up very fast before banking back into the clouds.
The observer estimated the size of the object to be around 50 feet across.
The observer estimated the speed of the object to be between 500-600 mph.
No physical evidence was found, but the observer took a Polaroid photograph of the object, which was later analyzed by the Air Force and determined to be a genuine image.
The Air Force investigation could not provide a positive conclusion about the identity of the sighted object.
photographs: yes, Polaroid photograph taken by the observer
